info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 6:43PM MDT until June 23 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL STILLWATER COUNTY... At 643 PM MDT, Flooding was indicated by radar and reported by law enforcement in and near Rapelje. Radar estimates between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to half an inch is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Rainfall has lightened up over the past hour, but rain is still falling. It will take time for runoff to subside in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and Law Enforcement reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, rural roads, highways, streets, along with poor drainage and low- lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rapelje and Hailstone Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sixshooter Creek and Cummin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
